intro: Centropogon aristi, commonly known as the red mangrove, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive red bark and aerial roots. The plant thrives in brackish water environments, often found in mangrove forests along coastal areas. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically producing nectar that attracts various pollinators. The plant plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for marine and terrestrial wildlife.
